Exaggerate: The claim exaggerates the impact of the 2017 tax law by stating that there was virtually no new business investment after its implementation.
Understate: The claim understates the growth in business investment by not acknowledging that business investment has grown rapidly from the fourth quarter of 2017 to the third quarter of 2018.
Lack enough support: The claim lacks enough support as it only cites one news article that mentions "modest" investment after the tax law was passed.
Problematic assumption: The claim assumes that the bulk of the tax cuts were used to buy back stocks without providing sufficient evidence.
Exist alternative explanation: The claim does not consider alternative explanations for the level of business investment, such as the impact of energy markets on investment.
